p: The use of JAK inhibitors is associated with an increased risk of serious infection, herpes zoster virus reactivation, and VTE. However, recent studies show potential direct antiviral and anti-inflammatory effects in COVID-19, seemingly unique to ruxolitinib and baricitinib. Taken together, there are insufficient data at this time to fully characterize the risk of harm or benefit in SARS-CoV-2 infection.
